result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph P Tiernan

records.addlTxt: 10:35 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing. Defendant Joseph P Tiernan in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Joseph P Tiernan.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes  the matter is set for trial to begin next week and inquires as to the status.  Atty. Rypel advises that defense is prepared to proceed to trial next week. Atty. Rypel also notes he reviewed the State's proposed jury instructions and is in agreement with them so he will not be filing his own proposed jury instructions.  State is also prepared to proceed to trial next week, noting that there are no other outstanding issues at this time.  Court will maintain the currently scheduled jury trial set for 2 days beginning 11/08/2022, but notes there are other cases still set for trial.  The clerks office will be in touch with counsel to advise if the matter will not be able to proceed on Tuesday.
Filed by the State
Filed by the State
Defendant's Preliminary Witness List filed by Atty. Rypel.
Defendant's Motion in Limine filed by Atty. Rypel.
Trial Order signed by Judge Paul F Reilly October 6, 2022.

Jury status hearing on November 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:45 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Joseph P Tiernan in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Joseph P Tiernan.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Rypel provides an update; he is asking the matter be set for a 2 day jury trial.  State agrees.  Court adjourns for jury status and jury trial.  Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

09:36 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Joseph P Tiernan in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rypel provides an update, he needs additional time to discuss the case with the State.  Atty. Rypel requests a projected plea and sentencing date in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Joseph P Tiernan in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rypel provides an update, he has discovery and an offer but needs additional time to review everything with his client.  Atty. Rypel requests another further proceedings date in July.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:46 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Joseph P Tiernan in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rypel advises he has discovery but is still waiting on an offer, he is requesting a further proceedings date.  State advises there is an offer in the file and will route it to Atty. Rypel.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in about 30-45 days.  Atty. Rypel also notes that his client is asking that the fees for court appointed attorney be taken directly from his account and not his paycheck.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the request is denied.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: 10:12 AM Defendant Joseph P Tiernan appeared by Zoom with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Prelim Waived.
Clerks letter to Defendant regarding Court appointed Attorney.
Hearing on March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph P Tiernan
Current: 8925 W Hampton Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: 8925 W Hampton Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53225

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A-C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing April 1, 2022. (BC)

records.addlTxt:
10:45 AM Defendant Joseph P Tiernan in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing April 1, 2022.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
